p: The TPC are a consensual index for oil degradation, corresponding to the sum of OTG with polymeric forms (DPTG), diglycerides (DG) and free fatty acids (FFA), with 22%–25% as the limit for rejection in several European countries (Gertz, 2000). For the polymeric forms, DF potatoes had significantly higher amounts (5.9%–7.8%), being only residual in the two low‐fat approaches (3.1–3.9), without differences between them (Table 2). The oxidized triglycerides (OTG), again higher in DF, enabled a distinction between the low‐fat processes, with higher amounts in MWG than OV for SO and CO.
